name: Loopy Over Lawrence! Quiz | Musicals | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who originated the role of Lawrence Jameson on Broadway?
questions.explanation:
John Lithgow.

	Lithgow was nominated for a Tony for his portrayal of Lawrence in the musical "Dirty Rotten Scoundrels". Michael Caine played Lawrence in the film.

questions.text: Who is the first woman Lawrence Jameson swindles in the number "Give Them What They Want"?
questions.explanation:
Lenore.

	Lenore, whose husband turns ninety-four this May, is looking for an escape from the ennui.

questions.text: To cheat women out of their money, Lawrence Jameson poses as a deposed prince. What is the name of his fictional little brother?
questions.explanation:
Ruprecht.

	When he finds himself in a spot of trouble with an overly eager woman, Lawrence calls on his little brother, the insane prince Ruprecht, to scare her away!

questions.text: Lawrence's rival is the younger swindler Freddie Benson. What fake personage does Lawrence Jameson create to discourage Freddie?
questions.explanation:
Doctor Emil Shuffhausen.

	Lawrence mercilessly whacks Freddie with a pussy willow branch in the musical number "Ruffhousin' Mit Shuffhausen".

questions.text: No man is an island; Lawrence Jameson relies heavily on his trusted right-hand man played by Gregory Jbara. By the by, of what nationality is Jbara's character?
questions.explanation:
French.

	Andre Thibault is the chief of police in the resort town of Beaumont Sur Mer. Convenient, no?

questions.text: What is the name of the woman Lawrence Jameson falls in love with?
questions.explanation:
Christine Colgate.

	"You're out of luck when love sneaks in on you." Lawrence realizes in the musical number "Love Sneaks In".

questions.text: Where does Lawrence Jameson first try to swindle Christine Colgate?
questions.explanation:
A casino.

	Lawrence and Freddie agree that the first person to get $50,000 from Christine can stay in Beaumont sur Mer. The loser has to leave.

questions.text: When he meets Freddie for the first time, what does Lawrence Jameson pose as?
questions.explanation:
A shy dentist.

	Lawrence fools Freddie into going on a trip to the Straits of Gibraltar, but Freddie soon realizes he's been duped, and returns to wreak havoc upon Lawrence.

questions.text: What does Lawrence Jameson see all his deceptions as?
questions.explanation:
A thousand flawless pearls.

	"When you look back on all your conquests and deceptions/You see a thousand flawless pearls set in a strand." Lawrence sings in the musical number "Dirty Rotten Number".

questions.text: What is the last role Lawrence Jameson assumes in the show?
questions.explanation:
Don Diego Fernando Alahambra.

	When Christine, Freddy and Lawrence set out to scam a Greek oil tycoon, Lawrence becomes Don Diego Fernando Alahambra, the king of Spanish real estate.
